item.title: Pakistan will continue attacks on Afghanistan - minister
item.description: Khawaja Asif said the aerial strikes were targeting groups which his government accuses to targeting security forces and civilians.

item.title: Rishi Sunak Hunts For Votes Among Robots, At 4:50 AM
item.description: Sunak, who has often looked exhausted as he crisscrossed the country during a six-week campaign, started the penultimate day before Thursday's vote in a vast Ocado warehouse in Luton, north of London, watching robots pick items for delivery.

item.title: 8 Killed As Israel Attacks Gaza After Evacuation Order
item.description: Israeli forces carried out deadly strikes Tuesday on southern Gaza after the army again ordered Palestinians to leave areas near the besieged territory's border with Israel and Egypt.

item.title: UK election opinion polls: Labour maintain significant lead over Tories as polling day approaches
item.description:
Find out who’s up and who’s down in the latest general election opinion polls – and how many seats each party is likely to win in the 2024 general election

  • UK general election: find your new constituency – and see how it would have voted in 2019
  • UK general election: the seats the Tories will lose if the polls are right
  • Support the Guardian’s UK election coverage today

As the general election campaign comes to a close and 4 July 2024 approaches, polling shows little sign of shifting, with a small drop in Labour support over the campaign.

But after 14 years of Conservative rule, Keir Starmer’s Labour has been consistently ahead of the Conservatives in the polls since the start of 2022.

Continue reading...

item.title: There is one big reason why Joe Biden refuses to step aside
‘Hello from my Black job’: Black Democrats share workplace photos after Trump’s offensive debate line
